alert.note: Alert for Cass; Douglas; Otoe; Sarpy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 11:18PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mills, southwestern Pottawattamie, Sarpy, north central Otoe, southeastern Douglas and Cass Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Papillion to 3 miles southeast of Eagle. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bellevue, Papillion, Ralston, Offutt AFB, La Vista, South Omaha and Walnut Creek Recreation Area around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Weeping Water and Avoca. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 35 and 43. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 435 and 444. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
